greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangular array T(i,j) read by downwards antidiagonals: an interspersion associated with the fractal sequence A022328.
comment: T(i,j) is the position of 2^i in the increasing sequence of the numbers 2^i*3^j, for i >= 0 and j >= 0; or equivalently, in the signature sequence of log(3)/log(2). A255975 is not equal to A051037; e.g., row 1 of A255975 includes 49, unlike A051037.
example: The fractal sequence A022328 starts with 0, 1, 0, 2, 1, 3, 0, 2, 4, 1, 3, 0, 5, 2, 4, 1, 6, 3, ..., with 0 in positions 1, 3, 7, 12, ... as in row 1 of T; with 1 in positions 2, 5, 10, ... as in row 2; etc.
mathematica: Flatten[Table[v[[k, n - k + 1]], {n, 1, 16}, {k, 1, n}]] (* A255975 sequence *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 19 2015
